intro: Linum nestleri, commonly known as the Nestlé flax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue or purple flowers. The plant produces small, oval seeds that are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. Linum nestleri thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool climate to flourish. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
